content: I can say that documentaries can definitely be biased. documentaries are made by filmmakers who have their own perspectives, and they may choose to present information in a way that supports their beliefs or opinions. while some documentaries strive to present a balanced viewpoint and show both sides of an issue, others are explicitly one-sided and may exclude opposing viewpoints or evidence that doesn't fit their narrative. additionally, the selection of experts, footage, and interviews can all be used to manipulate the narrative of a documentary. therefore, it is important to critically analyze and evaluate the content of documentaries before accepting them as factual and unbiased sources of information.
